reviewText: Not much needs to be said about a Bette Davis film.  She is the epitomy of what an actress should be - perfection!  She gives her all in every performance.  I never tire of watching any of her movies over and over again.  I own almost all of her movies - over 100 of them.  There will never be another one like her.  To say I admire the talent of this outstanding woman would be a severe understatement.

I GIVE THE DVD A 1 STAR NOT THE MOVIE. JUST TO LET YOU GUYS KNOW THAT A NEW 2 DISC EDITION IS COMING OUT OF THIS FILM.

Now... here's a look at some more of the 200 new-to-DVD titles coming in 2006:

The Bette Davis Collection, Volume 2 - including a new Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?: Two-Disc Special Edition (1962 - with new and vintage documentaries and never-before-seen footage), Jezebel (1938), Old Acquaintance (1943), Marked Woman (1937) and The Man Who Came to Dinner (1942).

STAY TUNED TO DIGITAL BITS FOR RELEASE DATES- [...]
